subsections.title: Coax Impedance and Loss
subsections.label: subsec:coax-imp
prompts: Explain the concept of coaxial cable impedance and why 50 ohms is the most common impedance in amateur radio.
Describe the factors that contribute to signal loss in coaxial cables and how frequency affects this loss.
Compare the electrical characteristics of different types of coaxial cables, such as RG-58 and RG-213.
Discuss the practical implications of using coaxial cables with different loss characteristics in amateur radio setups.

image_prompts.prompt: Diagram showing the structure of a coaxial cable with labels for the inner conductor, dielectric, and outer shield.
image_prompts.caption: Structure of a coaxial cable.
image_prompts.label: fig:coax-structure

image_prompts.prompt: Graph showing signal loss in dB per 100 feet for different types of coaxial cables (e.g., RG-58, RG-213) at various frequencies.
image_prompts.caption: Signal loss comparison for different coaxial cables.
image_prompts.label: fig:coax-loss

table_prompt.prompt: Create a table comparing the electrical characteristics (impedance, loss, power handling) of common coaxial cables used in amateur radio.
table_prompt.caption: Comparison of common coaxial cables.
table_prompt.label: tab:coax-comparison

subsections.title: Connectors (PL-259, Type N, etc.)
subsections.label: subsec:connectors
prompts: Explain the differences between PL-259 and Type N connectors, including their typical usage frequencies and applications.
Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of using PL-259 connectors in amateur radio setups.
Describe the importance of choosing the right RF connector for high-frequency operations.

image_prompts.prompt: Diagram showing the physical structure of a PL-259 connector.
image_prompts.caption: Structure of a PL-259 connector.
image_prompts.label: fig:pl259-structure

image_prompts.prompt: Diagram showing the physical structure of a Type N connector.
image_prompts.caption: Structure of a Type N connector.
image_prompts.label: fig:typeN-structure

table_prompt.prompt: Create a table comparing the characteristics (frequency range, power handling, durability) of PL-259 and Type N connectors.
table_prompt.caption: Comparison of PL-259 and Type N connectors.
table_prompt.label: tab:connector-comparison

subsections.title: Installation and Maintenance
subsections.label: subsec:install-maint
prompts: Explain the importance of proper installation and maintenance of antenna systems, including feed lines and connectors.
Discuss the common causes of erratic SWR readings and how to troubleshoot them.
Describe best practices for maintaining coaxial cables and connectors to ensure optimal performance.

image_prompts.prompt: Diagram showing a typical amateur radio antenna installation with labels for the antenna, feed line, and connectors.
image_prompts.caption: Typical amateur radio antenna installation.
image_prompts.label: fig:antenna-installation

table_prompt.prompt: Create a table listing common issues in antenna installation and maintenance, along with their solutions.
table_prompt.caption: Common issues and solutions in antenna installation and maintenance.
table_prompt.label: tab:antenna-issues

subsections.title: Standing Wave Ratio (SWR)
subsections.label: subsec:standing-wave
prompts: Explain the concept of Standing Wave Ratio (SWR) and its significance in antenna systems.
Describe how an antenna tuner (antenna coupler) works to match the antenna system impedance to the transceiver's output impedance.
Discuss the relationship between SWR and signal efficiency in amateur radio setups.

image_prompts.prompt: Graph showing the relationship between SWR and signal efficiency.
image_prompts.caption: Relationship between SWR and signal efficiency.
image_prompts.label: fig:swr-efficiency

image_prompts.prompt: Diagram showing the operation of an antenna tuner in matching impedance.
image_prompts.caption: Operation of an antenna tuner.
image_prompts.label: fig:antenna-tuner

table_prompt.prompt: Create a table summarizing the effects of different SWR values on signal efficiency and potential damage to equipment.
table_prompt.caption: Effects of SWR on signal efficiency and equipment.
table_prompt.label: tab:swr-effects
